news_header: Yoon Suk Yeol, South Korea's impeached president, faces trial for insurrection charges after imposing martial law.
news_original_title: South Korea: President Yoon faces criminal trial
news_text: South Korea's impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol appeared in court for his criminal trial over insurrection charges. He is the first South Korean president to face such charges. Yoon imposed martial law briefly, leading to his impeachment. Prosecutors accuse him of being the 'ringleader of an insurrection.' His lawyers argue he acted to alert the public about a national crisis. The Constitutional Court is considering his dismissal or reinstatement.
